item.title: Links
item.description: Awesomeness Awesome - Link to Awesomenes. Awesome Modern C++ - Curated list of awesome modern C++ resources Blogs Fluent C++ - An excellent resource for writing expressive code in C++ High Scalability Morning Dew Newsletters The Browser - Daily curated newsletter Tools VS Code - My go to text editor CLion - Trying out this C++ editor Balsamiq - Great tool for wireframes

item.title: Slides
item.description: Welcome to my slides. As I learn, I find it easy to take notes in a markdown file. I've turned my notes into slides using Reveal.js. This is an excellent presentation framework built in HTML / Javascript. You can build excellent presentations off your markdown files. I plan to convert more of my notes into slide in the days to come. Stay tuned … Design / Architecture SOLID - Object oriented design principles (Robert C Martin)

item.title: Resume
item.description: This browser does not support PDFs. Please download the PDF to view it: Download PDF.

item.title: Prelude
item.description: I'm passionate about technology in general and programming. My first introduction to computers was in my junior year of High School when my parents got us Sinclair ZX Spectrum 128K. While I primarily used it for playing games, I did get to code simple BASIC programs. Never did I imagine then it would end up as a Software Engineer. I went on to finish my Masters (Computer Applications) and over the years I've worked with multitude of technologies, languages, frameworks and tools.

item.title: Hello
item.description: I'm Vasu Balakrishnan, a passionate technologist, software development leader and technical architect. Welcome to my site. Stay tuned for updates, as I curate the content …

SOLID Solid Principles of Object Oriented Programming to make software designs more understandable, flexible and maintenable SRP Single Responsibility Principle A class should've a single responsibility OCP Open Closed Principle Types should be open for extension, but closed for modification LSP Liskov Subsitution Principle Objects in a program should be replaceable with instances of their sub-type without altering correctness of that program

item.title: About me
item.description: Accomplished software development leader and a passionate technologist dedicated to continuous learning and professional growth. When I'm not working, I love to bike, hike, play badminton or ping-pong. Disclaimer: The opinions expressed herein are my own personal opinions and do not represent my employerâ€™s view in any way.
